description.p: Detection: Psychic

You heal more quickly than normal and regain 1d4 hit points when you manifest this power, up to a maximum amount equal to the damage you received within the last round. You stop bleeding when you manifest this power and don’t lose hit points from blood loss or bleeding while this power remains in effect as your wounds close rapidly.
You can’t regain transferred hit points, such as from empathic transference.
0. When you reach 5th level, you regain an additional 1d4 hit points when you manifest this power (2d4), at 11th level you regain a further 1d4 (3d4), and once again at 17th level (4d4).
1. You regain 1 hit point at the start of each of your turns so long as this power remains in effect.
You can empower this augmentation to increase the amount healed in this way by 1 point per additional 4 power points spent.
2. Increase any healing you receive while this power is in effect by 1 point per die. Effects that heal without a die roll aren’t affected. You can take this augmentation multiple times.

3. You regain 1d8 hit points without restriction when you first manifest this power in addition to the amount you regain from injury sustained in the previous round. You can take this augmentation multiple times.
4. Remove one poison or disease at the end of each of your turns while this power is in effect.
4. Change the range to touch. This power has no effect on constructs, elementals, or undead.
6. Increase the maintenance time to 2 minutes.
6. You can manifest this power as a reaction when you take damage. Only damage from the attack that triggered this reaction can be regained in this manner.
9. Any number of severed limbs can be reattached if within 5 feet of you while this power remains in effect by using your action.
You can empower this augmentation to regenerate missing limbs at the rate of one limb per minute by spending 4 additional power points (13).
Detection: Psychic

When confronted with conditions outside the norm, your body adapts to these conditions. While this power is in effect, you don’t suffer the effects of extreme temperatures (though you still take cold or fire damage).
The effects of this power last until the end of your next turn unless you choose to maintain the power.

1. You gain the ability to perceive the world using one of your other senses, such as feeling light, or seeing sound. Through this function, you can counteract blindness or deafness by changing how you perceive the sensory stimulus, by hearing or feeling light in the case of blindness or feeling or seeing sound in the case of deafness.

At the time of manifestation, you select one sense (sight, hearing, taste, smell, or touch) and one additional way you can perceive it that would normally fall under one of the five senses. For instance you could choose to see taste to determine what contents are in vial, or you could feel sight and be able to see normally without opening your eyes (thus avoiding meeting the gaze of a creature).
Illusion effects, including blur and invisibility, will still confuse your synesthete senses as they would your normal senses.

You can empower this augmentation by spending 0 power points when you take no other augmentation except increasing the maintenance time to manifest this power using a bonus action and without requiring a trigger condition.
2. Increase the maintenance time to 10 minutes.

You can empower this augmentation to increase the maintenance time to 1 hour by spending an additional 3 power points (5). You can further empower it by spending 4 more power points (9) to increase the maintenance to 24 hours.

3. When you take damage from any source, you gain damage resistance to that damage type. On successive rounds while this power is in effect, you can use your reaction again against another damage source. When you do so, you must choose which resistance to maintain.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 8 power points (11) to gain immunity instead of resistance if you maintain resistance for at least 3 rounds. If you use your reaction to gain resistance to another damage type and choose to maintain the new damage resistance, you lose immunity until maintaining the new resistance for at least 3 rounds.

7. Your body adapts to survive hostile environments, including underwater or even airless locations. You don’t need to state which adaptations you take on, it happens automatically. You can breathe anywhere and can’t suffocate. You are also immune to the poisoned condition. Environmental hazards such as lava and acidic clouds only deal half damage, but spells, powers, and abilities deal normal damage.

13. Your body gains extreme resilience to conditions. When you are afflicted by the blinded, deafened, paralyzed, petrified, or poisoned conditions, you automatically remove the condition at the start of your next turn and can’t suffer that condition again while this power remains in effect.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you take when you take damage, encounter a hostile environment, or are afflicted with a condition

description.p: Detection: Psychic, Gesture

You can increase the intensity of lightning, create sparks, or manipulate electrical currents within a field covering a 10-foot cube. When you manifest this power you can choose to have electricity amplified, diminished, or redirected within the cube. This power remains in effect until the start of your next turn when it is no longer maintained.

An amplified electricity field causes lightning damage dealt to targets within it to deal an additional 1 lightning damage per die. Additionally, each creature that begins its turn within the area must make a Constitution saving throw. If this save is failed, it takes 1 lightning damage. If the creature suffered lightning damage within the previous round, it makes this save with disadvantage.

A diminish electricity field grants each creature within the cube advantage on saving throws against lightning damage. Attack rolls for attacks that deal lightning damage made against each creature within the field are made with disadvantage.

If you redirect electricity, you may use your reaction whenever a lightning damaging effect passes through, originates within, or targets inside your field. You make a ranged power attack against an AC equal to the spell or power save DC of the originator. If successful, you can pick one 5-foot section within your cube to be affected. A creature within that space takes the normal effects of the lightning source. Any creature within a different space of your field is unaffected.

During your turn, you may take a bonus action to change the type of field. Each augmentation that affect a specific field type is suppressed while the field is of a different type, but resume when the field is switched back.

1. Increase your amplified field’s damage by 1 point. You can take this augmentation multiple times. For every 3 power points spent this way, the lightning damage from other sources deal an additional 1 damage per die against targets within the field.
2. You can use your action to move your field up to 30 feet on your turn.

2. You can use your redirection field to instead spread lightning effects to each space within your field. You must decide whether to redirect or spread when you first manifest this power and at the start of each of you turns while it remains in effect. If the lightning effect comes from an ally, you automatically succeed your ranged power attack.
3. Increase the dimensions of your field by 10 feet. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 12 power points.
5. Each creature within your diminished field gains damage resistance to lightning. Additionally, if it passes its Dexterity saving throw to reduce lightning damage, it instead takes no damage.
You can empower this effect to grant creatures within your diminishing field immunity to lightning by spending an additional 8 power points (13).

7. Using your reaction, you can trap any electrical effect that passes through, originates from, or targets a space within your field. A trapped lightning spell, power, or ability has no effect. During your next turn, you can use your action to produce the effect against a target within 30 feet of your field. Damage and effects are identical to the original source, but use your power attack or power save DC. If you don’t use your action to use the trapped effect, it dissipates.

9. You can use your action to cause your field to fire a spark of electricity up to 30 feet away. Make a range power attack against a target, which if it hits deals 4d8 + 8 lighting damage. Each creature within 5 feet of your target must make a Dexterity saving through. If the save is failed, it takes 2d8 + 4 lightning damage. If the save is successful, it takes half the damage.
You can empower this augmentation, increasing the damage by 2d8 on the direct attack and 1d8 on the area of effect for every 3 additional power points you spend to a maximum of 9 points.

11. Your diminishing field will harm creatures composed of electricity. Each such creature within the field when you manifest or move it, which begins its turn within the field, or that enters or reenters the field must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature takes 8d12 necrotic damage. If successful, the creature takes no damage.
13. You can use your action to transform your field into a static elemental golem under your control or to transform the golem back into the field.

You can use a bonus action to direct the golem. Until otherwise ordered, the golem will repeat your last direction if able. If unable and you don’t direct the golem, it will hover in place and take no action, but it will defend itself if attacked.
Your golem’s hit points persist between states. Any lightning damage dealt inside a redirected field can be redirected to heal the golem for an amount equal to the damage dealt.
You can use the golem to trap electrical effects if you manifested this power with that augmentation as if it were the field.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture

This power enables you to modify the memories of a creature. Alterations are generally temporary, but can be augmented to be permanent. The creature must make an Intelligence saving throw, and if you are fighting the creature, it has advantage on the saving throw. If the save is successful, the power fails and can’t be maintained.

You can suppress the memory of a creature of a single recent event, such as your presence or a task it was given. If the creature fails its saving through, it can’t recall the event so long as the power remains in effect. The event can have occurred no longer than 1 minute prior to manifesting this power.
1. You can affect longer blocks of memory or more distant memories. You can affect memories up to 1 hour ago and up to 1 minute long.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 3 power points (4) to affect memories up to 24 hours ago and up to 10 minutes long. By spending an additional 4 power points (8) you can affect memories up to 1 year old and 1 hour long. For 4 more power points (12) you can affect any memory and alter up to 24 hours of memories.
2. You can target one additional creature, provided it is within range. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 10 power points.

3. You can suppress memory of a single tool, skill, or weapon proficiency on a creature. A natural weapon is a valid proficiency for purposes of this power. An affected creature can’t add its proficiency bonus to die rolls of the suppressed proficiency while this power remains in effect.
4. The power lingers for 1 hour per round you maintained this power. After each hour, the creature makes a new Intelligence saving throw to break free of the memory alteration.
You can empower this augmentation to increase the time it will linger by 1 hour per round of maintenance for each additional power point you spend this way.
Alternately, you can spend an additional 8 power points (12) to empower this augmentation to be permanent until removed through Psychic Chirurgery, greater restoration, or dispel evil and good.
5. You can replace the memory of a creature or insert a memory into it. The memory can be no longer than one minute, and replaces only the most recent minute.
If contradictory information clashes with the modified memory, the target makes a new Intelligence saving throw. If successful, the altered or added memory is removed or the lost memory is restored.

15. Mental tendrils wrap around a creature’s mind when you manifest this power, ripping away its memory of the past minute and every passing moment. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is dazed and unable to take actions or reactions while this power remains in effect. At the end of each of its turns, it makes a new saving throw. If successful, the power’s effects end on it.
The creature can’t concentrate if affected by this power, and loses any effect or ability that requires concentration.
Detection: Psychic, Visual (overt)

You create a spectral crossbow (or similar device that can make ranged attacks) which fires gooey ectoplasm. You can direct it to move and attack by taking a bonus action. If the construct hits a creature, the creature’s next attack is made with disadvantage.

The crossbow is a Tiny construct that has AC 13, 10 hit points, a flight speed of 20 feet, hovers, and damage resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons. The crossbow automatically generates ectoplasm bolts without the need to reload. It has the range of a hand crossbow (30/120).
Attacks made by an astral construct or shambler count as from a magical weapon and use your power attack modifier.
0. When you reach 5th level, your astral construct gains 20 hit points (30), 20 more hit points at 11th level (50), and once more at 17th level (70).
1. Your construct’s bolts deal 1d4 + you manifester ability bonus force damage.
You can empower this augmentation, increasing the force damage by 1d4 per 4 additional power points spent.
2. Increase your construct’s range to that of a heavy crossbow (100/400).

3. Increase the area of effect of your bolts by a 5-foot radius. You must take an augmentation that adds an area of effect to take this augmentation. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 15 power points.

5. Your construct’s bolts explode into twisted webs made of hardened ectoplasm in a 5-foot radius. Each creature caught in this area must make a Strength saving throw. If this save is failed, the creature is restrained so long as this power remains in effect. At the end of each of the creature’s turns it makes a new saving throw to escape the web. If a creature escapes the web, it has its movement speed halved for one minute, until this power ends, or until it (or an ally) uses its action to remove the ectoplasm.
Ectoplasm webs can be attacked. Each 5-foot section has AC 10, 40 hit points, and damage immunity to blunt, cold, piercing, poison, psychic, and thunder.

5. Your construct’s bolts explode. Instead of making a ranged power attack roll, your construct strikes a 5-foot radius sphere. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the save is failed, it takes whatever effects your construct delivers. If the save is successful, it doesn’t suffer disadvantage from the bolt and damage, if any, is halved.

7. A creature of Large size or smaller hit by an ectoplasm bolt must make a Strength saving throw. If the save is failed, it is pushed 10 feet away from the construct. When pairing this augmentation with the web augmentation, the webs will snare the target in its new space if it fails its saving throw against the ectoplasm webs.

9. When you use your astral construct’s attack, you can take a reaction to create an astral shambler in a space adjacent to the target. The astral shambler acts on its own initiative and will attack the nearest creature. You can only create one shambler per manifester ability bonus you have (minimum 1). During your turn, you can dismiss each astral shambler you choose created by this power.
Detection: Psychic, Visual (overt)

Your skin transforms into a hardened substance, granting AC 12 + your Dexterity modifier. This harden substance is still organic despite appearances, and is not subject to vulnerabilities such as from the shatter spell.
Armor Class granted by this power counts as natural armor and doesn’t stack with worn armor, natural armor, or similar effects that don’t stack with armor such an the Unarmored Defense feature.

0. At 5th level, you can maintain this power for 1 additional minute (3 minutes). You can maintain it for another minute at 11th level (4 minutes), and again at 17th level (5 minutes). This is in addition to any maintenance time gained from augmenting this power.
1. You can manifest this power as a reaction when you are hit by an attack.
1. You can maintain this power for 2 additional minutes. You can take this augmentation multiple times.
2. Increase the AC granted by this power by 1. This augmentation can be taken multiple times up to 16 power points.

3. Prevent up to 5 points of damage each round. At the start of each of your turns, so long as this power remains in effect, the amount of damage prevented refreshes. This augmentation can be taken multiple times up to 12 power points.

4. You can substitute your Constitution modifier in place of your Dexterity modifier to AC. This applies to worn armor as well, but can’t exceed your armor’s max Dexterity bonus. If you have the Unarmored Defense feature, you can’t add your Constitution more than once to your AC.
5. Gain resistance to poison and advantage on saving throws against disease and the poisoned condition.
9. Gain resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagical weapons.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture, Visual (overt)

You can control and manipulate blood. You must have a source of exposed blood to use this power. You can trivially cut yourself to use this power when you manifest it, using your own space as the point of origin. If a creature is called to make a Constitution saving throw, it only makes one save and applies the result to each effect.

When you first manifest this power, and by using your action while this power remains in effect, you can lash any target within 10 feet of the blood source by making a melee power attack. If you hit, you deal 1d6 + you manifesting ability modifier slashing damage.
0. At 5th level, you deal an additional 1d6 slashing damage (2d6) with the blood lash. At 11th level this damage improves by another 1d6 (3d6), and once again at 17th level (4d6).
1. When you hit a creature with a blood lash, it must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed it takes an additional 1d6 damage from blood loss, provided it can bleed.
You can empower this augmentation, increasing the damage by 1d6 for every additional 3 power points you spend up to a maximum of 9 power points.

5. When you hit with a blood lash, it becomes a tendril that grapples a Medium or smaller target, restraining it. A blood tendril can be attacked, has AC 13, 18 hit points, and immunity to bludgeoning, necrotic, poison, and psychic damage. As long as this power is in effect, a creature grappled by the tendril automatically takes damage from your blood tendril at the end of your turn. An affected creature can use its action to break free of the tendril by making a Strength check against a DC 13.
If you attack a different target, the existing tendril collapses into blood and the creature is immediately freed.
You can empower this augmentation to affect a Large creature by spending an additional 4 power points (9).

7. Your blood lash causes a creature’s blood to erupt internally. A creature hit by your blood lash also must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, it is stunned until the end of its next turn.

9. You siphon the blood from a creature hit by your blood lash to another willing creature within 10 feet of your blood lash’s source. The creature recovers one half the damage your lash deals plus one half of any damage from blood loss. Any healing beyond a creature’s maximum hit points is converted into a shield of blood that grants it temporary hit points equal to the excess amount that lasts until the end of its next turn when the blood collapses to the ground.
Detection: Psychic
You have the ability to adjust your body and its functions, and are able to stifle physical discomfort or ever shift your physical abilities.

You can increase or decrease your heart rate, breathing, or perspiration, cause yourself to be perfectly still, or shift your body mass to allow minor changes to your appearance (such as appearing fat or thin or changing the length of your hair). Any alterations last only as long as this power remains in effect.
1. You suppress pain and have advantage on saving throws against effects that rely on pain or the illusion of pain.
3. Transfer 1 point of Dexterity or Constitution to Strength. You can’t reduce an ability score to less than 5, nor can you increase an ability score beyond your racial maximum.

You can empower this augmentation to increase the number of points transferred by 1 for every 2 additional power points you spend up to a maximum of 8 power points. When shifting 2 or more ability points, the points don’t have to come from the same ability score.
3. Transfer 1 point of Strength or Constitution to Dexterity. You can’t reduce an ability score to less than 5, nor can you increase an ability score beyond your racial maximum.

You can empower this augmentation to increase the number of points transferred by 1 for every 2 additional power points you spend up to a maximum of 8 power points. When shifting 2 or more ability points, the points don’t have to come from the same ability score.
3. Transfer 1 point of Strength or Dexterity to Constitution. You can’t reduce an ability score to less than 5, nor can you increase an ability score beyond your racial maximum.

You can empower this augmentation to increase the number of points transferred by 1 for every 2 additional power points you spend up to a maximum of 8 power points. When shifting 2 or more ability points, the points don’t have to come from the same ability score.
5. You can ignore the penalties from exhaustion, even from starvation and thirst. This doesn’t remove the exhaustion level, and you can’t suppress death from exhaustion.
Detection: Psychic
Transforming your skin, you become like a chameleon, including any gear you carry.

While this power is in effect, you add your proficiency bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks. If you already have proficiency with Stealth, you instead gain a +2 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks while this power is in effect.
1. You blend into surrounding terrain, gaining advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks to avoid being seen.
2. Increase the maintenance time to 10 minutes.
You can empower this augmentation and increase your maintenance time by 10 minutes for every 3 additional power points up to a maximum of 15 power points.
3. You turn invisible until you attack, cast a spell, or manifest a power with a target other than you.

This augmentation can be empowered. By spending an additional 4 power points (7), you can use your action to turn invisible again while this power remains in effect. By spending a 4 more power points (11), you remain invisible so long as this power is in effect, regardless of actions taken.

4. You have expertise with Dexterity (Stealth) checks to avoid being detected while hiding and advantage with Disguise checks. Your camouflage or invisibility reacts perfectly to changes in your position.

5. You can alter your appearance to another creature of the same type and size, including worn items. Your statistics remain the same, and the changes are only visual. You can attempt to deceive creatures, treating your chameleon skin as a successful disguise.
On your turn you can change your form to another creature or alter the appearance of items worn by you.
Detection: Psychic
You can manipulate light in up to four 10-foot cubes. A light source must exist before this power can be used, and this power can’t use light it generates to power itself.
You can make dim light into bright light or bright light into dim light.
0. At 5th level, you control an additional two cubes (6 cubes). At 11th level you control another two cubes (eight), and once again at 17th level (10 cubes).
1. Increase the maintenance time by 1 minute. You can take this augmentation multiple times.

1. You can suppress light in the area making it one step darker (bright light to dim light, dim light to darkness). The source of the light isn’t destroyed when making dim light into darkness; it just appears to give off no light.

While this power remains in effect, you can decrease the intensity of the light by an additional step by using your action on successive turns. For instance, if light is cast within your effect area, you can diminish the light to dim light on your next turn, and then to darkness on the following turn.

3. Bright light flashes into blinding light in each 5-foot cube of light within your area you choose. Each creature within an affected cube must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature is blinded until the end of its next turn. Dim light you make bright through this power can be used.
You can use your action to cause light to again flash blindingly in each 5-foot cube you choose while this power remains in effect.

7. Twisting existing light, you are able to bend and move light from one location to another. You can reshape light you control into any shape so long as it is contiguous, within range of the power, and touching at least one light source. You can decide for each 5-foot cube whether the light is bright or dim. While maintaining this power, you may use a bonus action to move or reshape the light.

11. You intensify bright light into the equivalent of sunlight. Creatures with sunlight vulnerabilities are affected as if under broad daylight. Dim light you make bright through this power can be used.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (15). While this power remains in effect, you can use your action to cause the sunlight to burst in up to three 10-foot cubes you choose. Each creature in the area must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 4d6 radiant damage and is blinded for one minute. If the save is successful, the creature takes half damage and is not blinded. Undead and oozes make this saving throw with disadvantage. A blinded creature makes a new Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turn. If it succeeds on this save, the creature is no longer blinded.
Detection: Psychic

You can deliver toxins or diseases to foes. While this power is in effect, you can make a melee power attack against a creature within 5 feet of you using your action. If you hit, the creature takes 1d8 poison damage. If you can make multiple attacks using the Attack action, you can substitute one of your attack rolls with this power’s attack.
When you augment this power with multiple effects that call for a Constitution saving throw, a creature only makes one saving throw for all of the effects.
0. At 5th level you deal an additional 1d8 poison damage (2d8). At 11th level you deal another 1d8 poison damage (3d8), and once again at 17th level (4d8).

1. Each creature hit by this power’s attack must make a Constitution saving throw. If this save fails, the creature is poisoned for 1 minute. At the end of each of its turns, the creature makes a new saving throw.

You can empower this augmentation by spending additional power points. For every 4 power points you spend, a poisoned creature takes 1d4 poison damage at the start of each of its turns as long as it is poisoned.

You can also empower this augmentation to afflict the creature with a crippling disease by spending an additional 6 power points (7). Each time the creature fails its saving throw it loses 5 maximum hit points. Lost maximum hit points are regained at the rate of 5 hit points per long rest or if the disease is cured via means such as lesser restoration or accelerated healing.
3. A creature hit by this power must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, it takes 2d4 necrotic damage. If the save succeeds, the creature only takes half the damage.
You can empower this augmentation by spending additional power points. For every 2 additional power points you spend, increase the necrotic damage by 1d4 up to 8 power points.
4. You can spit your poison by making a ranged power attack. This attack is in place of your melee power attack and has a range of 120 feet.

8. Your poison transforms into a contagious disease. One creature you choose within 5 feet of a creature hit by your melee or ranged power attack or within your noxious cloud must make a Constitution saving throw. If this save fails, the creature is also hit by this power and suffers the full effects. If the save succeeds, the creature is unaffected.

You can empower this augmentation to affect an additional creature within 5 feet of a creature affected by it for every additional 2 power points spent to do so. You can target subsequent creatures. A creature can only be targeted by spreading poison once each round.

9. While this power is in effect your skin exudes a noxious cloud. Each creature that begins its turn within 10 feet of you must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature is poisoned for 1 minute and takes 2d8 poison damage. On your turn, you can suppress this aura at will until the beginning of your next turn.
Detection: Psychic
You reduce the damage from the attack by 1d8 + you manifesting ability modifier.
0. At 5th level you reduce damage from an attack by an additional 1d8 (2d8). At 11th level, you reduce damage further by 1d8 (3d8), and again at 17th level (4d8).

1. The range becomes 60 feet, allowing you to deflect attacks made against another target. If you augment this power to maintain it, the effect remains on the target you manifest the power on so long as it remains in effect.
3. You can reduce damage from each ranged attack made against you until the start of your next turn.
4. This power can be maintained for 2 minutes, reducing the damage of one ranged weapon attack you choose each round.

5. Once per round, an attack you reduce to 0 damage can be redirected. You can redirect the attack to anywhere within 60 feet of you. You make a ranged power attack to hit, and deal the same damage you would have taken + you manifesting ability modifier.

6. This power affects a 5-foot radius sphere centered on you or your target if you augmented this power to have a range. Each ranged weapon attack you choose that passes through, originate from, or target within the sphere has its damage reduced by half.
You can empower this augmentation to increase the radius by 5 feet for every 4 additional power points you spend.
7. You can affect ranged power attacks from the psychokinesis and psychometabolism disciplines and ranged spell attacks from the conjuration, evocation, necromancy, and transmutation schools.

setters.set: 1 reaction, which you use when you are hit by a ranged weapon attack

description.p: Detection: Psychic, Visual (glow)

You can create portals that allow objects (and creatures with certain augmentations) to pass through one end and appear out of the other. You create one portal at your space and second portal up to 120 feet from you.

While this power is in effect you can use your action to pass a handheld object through the portal to the other end. If a creature is there to receive the item, it does so without needing to take an action. Otherwise, the object falls to the ground.
Alternately, you can use your action to retrieve one unattended, handheld object from the other end of the portal to your hand.
1. When you take the Attack action, once on your turn you can make a melee attack against a target within 120 feet of you.

If you make a ranged attack through the portal, its range is increased by 120 feet, and you can change its direction when it passes through the portal. When you change direction this way, you can overcome cover.

The first attack through your breach you make against each creature during a battle is made with advantage. Most creatures remain on guard the first time they fall for this trick during the engagement.
You can empower this augmentation to allow an additional attack by spending 4 power points for each extra attack you can make through your portal.
2. Increase the distance your portal reaches by 40 feet. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 14 power points.

4. You can maintain this power for 2 additional rounds. When you do so, you can use your bonus action or action on subsequent turns to reactivate this power depending on the feature of the power you are using.
You can take this augmentation multiple times.
7. You can use your action to walk through your dimensional portal by using your action.

You can empower this augmentation to allow you to make one attack after passing through your portal by spending 4 additional power points (11). This attack is made with advantage and deals an additional 2d6 points of weapon damage.

9. You can use your portal to cast spells or manifest powers through it, extending your spell’s or power’s range by the distance of your portal. You can change its path when it passes through the portal allowing you to overcome cover.
A power which exceeds its range through this means can’t be maintained.

15. You can use your action to tear a rift from your portal to anywhere you are familiar within the same plane of existence you are on. You and each creature you choose with 10 feet of you are transported to that spot and this power ends. This augmentation can’t be taken with any other augmentation.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture
You penetrate the boundaries between the planes, liberating you from the restrictions of the Material Plane.
You can open a small pocket dimension to secret handheld items weighing no more than 10 pounds away. You have a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Sleight of Hands) checks to hide such an item.

1. You expand your pocket dimension into a space identical to a bag of holding. The opening moves with you for as long as this power is in effect. The contents of the dimensional space spill out all around you when this power ends.
2. Increase the maintenance time by 1 hour. You can take this augmentation multiple times.

5. You use your dimensional pocket to temporarily shift you into a transitive state between the Material Plane and the Shadowfell. When you move, you can ignore any movement impediments short of a solid barrier, such as a wall. You are immune to the restrained condition, and if you are already restrained, you are immediately freed when manifesting this power. You don’t trigger opportunity attacks when you take your movement.
You are still affected by hazards that don’t restrict movement such as fire, and you can still be attacked normally. If you aren’t on the Material Plane when you manifest this power, it fails.

9. You use your pocket dimension to shift to the border regions of the Ethereal Plane, in the area where it overlaps with your current plane. You remain there for as long as you maintain this power. During this time you can move in any direction. If you move up or down, every foot of movement costs an extra foot. You can see and hear the plane you originated from, but everything looks gray, and you can’t see more than 60 feet away.

While on the Ethereal Plane, you can only affect and be affected by other creatures on that plane. Creatures that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane can’t perceive you and can’t interact with you, unless a special ability, spell, or power has given them the ability to do so.
You ignore all objects and effects that aren’t on the Ethereal Plane, allowing you to move through objects you perceive on the plane you originated from.

When the power ends, you immediately return to the plane you originated from in the spot you currently occupy. If you occupy the same space as a solid object or creature when this happens, you are immediately moved to the nearest unoccupied space that you can occupy.
This power has no effect if you manifest it while you are on the Ethereal Plane or a plane that doesn’t border it, such as one of the Outer Planes.

13. Through your pocket dimension, you project your astral body into the Astral Plane. The material body you leave behind is unconscious and in a state of suspended animation; it doesn’t need food or air and doesn’t age.

Your astral body resembles your mortal form in almost every way, replicating your game statistics and possessions. The principle difference is the addition of a silvery cord that extends from between your shoulder blades and trails behind you, fading to invisible after 1 foot. This cord is your tether to your material body. As long as it remains intact, you can find your way home. If your cord is cut, you must make a Wisdom (Insight) check against a DC 15. If this check fails, you die instantly, your body and soul separated. If this check succeeds, you wake up in your body having successfully traced your mind and body.

Your astral form can freely travel through the Astral Plane and can pass through portals there leading to any other plane. If you enter a new plane or return to the plane you were on when you manifested this power, your body and possessions are transported along the silver cord, allowing you to re-enter your body as you enter the new plane. Your astral form is a separate incarnation. Any damage or other effects that apply to it have no effect on your physical body, nor do they persist when you return to it. Your astral form can maintain powers on its own while your body maintains this power. Additionally, while in your astral form, you body doesn’t suffer psychic strain from powers your astral form manifests, but your astral form will.

When you end this power, you awaken in your physical body. If your body or astral form drops to 0 hit points, the power immediately ends. It can also end when subjected to psychic static or dispel magic, and Psychic Chirurgery can extract you from the Astral Plane.
If you are already on the Astral Plane when you manifest this power, it will fail.

17. You expand your pocket dimension into a demiplane that is very small and minor. This demiplane is a reflection of your mind and you can determine the terrain and features of it, up to a 300-foot radius sphere. You can’t create life, but can create the appearance of plants through sculpted ectoplasm.

You demiplane exists on the Astral Plane and connects to the Astral Plane and the plane you manifested this power from. You, and anyone you allow, can travel between these two planes using your demiplane. You can also attempt to force a creature into your demiplane by succeeding a grapple and using a bonus action. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature is shunted into your demiplane.

While on your demiplane, you can take lair actions. You can alter your demiplane’s features, use it to manifest any power you know without expending your own power points, or attempt to imprison one creature. When changing features, you can move ground and object mass up to 50 feet in an instant or reshape up to a 50-foot cube of structures. If you attempt to imprison a creature, it must make a Charisma saving throw or become trapped within the demiplane as if under the effect of the imprisonment spell. You can only imprison one creature at a time. If you attempt to imprison another creature, the former creature is freed. Imprisoned creatures are able to freely move and act within your demiplane, but spells, powers, and effects that allow movement between planes used by the imprisoned creature will fail.

Once this power ends, you can no longer access your demiplane until you manifest this power again. The demiplane remains in existence while not maintained and can be found in the Astral Plane, but all entrances and exits to it are sealed, and a traveler must possess means, such as plane shift, to enter it.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture, Visual (glow)
Refashioning space and time, you create a temporary dimensional fold that moves yourself, an object weighing no more than 400 lbs., or a Large size or smaller creature to another location.

You move your target 5 feet in any direction. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. If this save succeeds it is not moved (when attempting to relocate multiple creatures, if one creature makes its saving throw, no creatures are moved).
When you augment this power, any augmentation effects replaces this function of the power.
0. At 5th level, the range of this power increases to 30 feet. At 11th level, the range increases to 60 feet. At 17th level the range increases to 100 feet.
1. You or a willing creature in range can swap places with another willing creature within range.

This augmentation can be empowered to affect an unwilling creature within range by spending an additional 4 power points (5). The creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature swaps position with your other target.
3. You affect one additional creature. Each creature affected must be in range and within 30 feet of each other. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 12 power points.
6. You can affect a creature of Huge size or smaller or an object weighing no more than 800 lbs.
You can empower this augmentation to affect a creature of any size or an object weighing up to 1 ton by spending an additional 6 power points (12).

7. You attempt to disrupt a creature’s temporal location. If the creature fails its Dexterity saving throw, it becomes translucent and semi-tangible. For 1 minute, it deals and takes only half damage, regains only half any restored hit points, and can’t make reactions or take bonus actions. Its movement rate is halved and appears to happen in flashes, and it can only perceive up to 60 feet with any senses it possesses. It is also immune to the grappled condition.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (11) to increase the duration to 10 minutes. By spending another 4 points (15), you can further increase the duration to 1 hour.

13. You send a creature 1 minute into the future. For the creature, no time passes at all. After the minute passes, the creature returns to the same spot it was before, dislodging anything occupying its space to the nearest unoccupied space.
You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (17) to send it forward in time 1 hour.
Detection: Psychic, Visual (glow)
You exert will over the destiny of a creature in range. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw, which if successful, stops the power from affecting it.
You cause a creature to make its first attack roll on its next turn with disadvantage.
1. A creature with disadvantage on an attack roll treats each roll above 15 as 15 until the start of your next turn.
3. A creature affected by this power is shown countless images of possible outcomes and suffers disadvantage on all attack rolls and ability checks until the end of its next turn.
4. You affect one additional creature. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 16 power points.

5. You cause the subject to repeat the action it took during its previous turn on its next turn. If it targeted another creature, object, or space, it will attempt to attack or aid that same target. For example, if a giant hurled a boulder at a square 40 feet away, it will throw another stone at that same space.

The target will consume any resource, including a bonus action, which it used when making the previous action. If the situation has changed in a way that the subject can’t take the same action, it instead takes no action. The creature can still move and use reactions as normal.
Once a creature has repeated its action the power’s effect ends.
7. A creature failing its saving throw is crippled by images of countless outcomes and is unable to take actions or bonus actions during its next turn.

9. You link the fate of two creatures in range to each other for 1 minute, provided each creature is within 30 feet of the other. At least two creatures must fail their Wisdom saving throws for this power to have effect. Whenever once creature is afflicted with the blinded, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained, or unconscious condition, the linked creature is also affected for the same duration. If a creature is knocked unconscious from damage, the unconscious condition is not shared to a linked creature. Other effects that cause disadvantage or impose penalties on attack rolls, ability checks, or saving throws are also shared with the linked creature. If a condition or effect is removed from one creature, it is removed from each linked creature.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 6 power points (15). If a creature takes damage, each linked creature takes the same damage. If the damaged creature is immune to the damage type inflicted, each linked creature takes no damage from this power. If a creature dies, each linked creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your power save DC. If this save is failed, the creature takes 5d6 necrotic damage. On a success it takes half the damage.

element.name: Dreamstate
element.description:
Detection: Psychic, Gesture
You are able to perceive and affect the dream realm. Subjects must be within 5 feet of you for you to focus on their dreams or enter them. While you view or enter a dream, your body is incapacitated.
While maintaining this power, you can use your action to focus on a sleeping creature and see the dream it is experiencing. You can only use this power on a creature once per 24-hour period.
1. When you focus on a creature for at least 1 hour, you can attempt to guide its dream in a way to reveal one fact the creature knows, including one which the creature is not aware it knows, such as a suppressed memory. An unwilling creature must make an Intelligence saving throw. If the save succeeds, its dream reveals nothing to you. When the creature awakens, it will become aware of this fact if it wasn’t already aware of it before.
You can focus on subsequent hours to learn additional facts or attempt to uncover the same one as a previous probe. If the dreamer has succeeded one saving throw against this power, it makes each subsequent saving throw against you at advantage for the remainder of its slumber.
3. If a creature, spell, power, or other effect is affecting the dream of a sleeping creature you are focused on, you are aware of the type of the creature or effect and have a general idea of how powerful it is.
5. You can use your action to leave your body and enter the dream of another sleeping creature on which you set your focus. While in the dream, you can use any clairsentient or telepathic powers on the subject or within the confines of the dream. If a hostile creature is within the subject’s dream, you can direct your clairsentient and telepathic powers against it.
You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (9). Doing so enables you to act as a dream architect within the subject’s dream, but you can’t enter an adjacent dream or travel outside the Dreamscape. 7.* If you spend one hour focused upon or within the dream of a nearby sleeping creature, you can alter its dream. You can grant the target an inspiring dream that grants the creature inspiration for 24 hours or until used. This instance of inspiration can’t be given away. If the creature is a player character that already has inspiration, this power has no effect.
7. If you spend one hour focused upon or within the dream of a nearby sleeping creature, you can alter its dream. You can grant the target a relieving dream that grants the creature peaceful rest. The creature loses one level of exhaustion, and suffers no nightmares or ill effects from spells, powers, or abilities that affect dreams for the duration of the sleep to a maximum of 8 hours of rest.
7. If you spend one hour focused upon or within the dream of a nearby sleeping creature, you can give the creature a horrific nightmare. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature suffers one level of exhaustion and loses the benefit of a full rest.
11. If you spend 4 hours focusing upon or within the dream of a nearby sleeping creature, you can weave their dream into a compelling world from which the dreamer doesn’t wish to awaken. The subject must make a Charisma saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature enters a deep slumber from which it doesn’t awaken. This slumber lasts for ten days. While in a deep slumber, the creature is unaffected by physical needs, such as hunger or thirst, and doesn’t age.
Only Psychic Chirurgery, dispel evil and good, or wish can end the slumber early.
You can empower this augmentation to last longer by spending additional power points. By spending 2 additional power points (13) the slumber will last one year plus an additional year for each extra power point you spend. If you spend at least 6 power points (17) this way, the slumber lasts until removed.
15. You gain the ability to enter the Dreamscape when focusing on a sleeping creature. You project your consciousness into a dream, becoming a dream architect able to navigate the Dreamscape. You can travel between the dreams of other creatures. When traveling to a plane other than the Dreamscape, your body is transported, along with all belongings carried on your person.
While in the Dreamscape, you can also manifest clairsentient and telepathic powers against a creature’s real body when you are within its dream. Only another creature operating within the Dreamscape can attack you. A dreamer is completely unaware of your presence so long as you choose, but if you attack its dream self, it becomes aware of you and can act according to dream logic.
If you remain in the Dreamscape when this power ends, or if your dream self is slain, you return to your body with no ill effects.

description.p: Detection: Psychic, Visual (overt)

You can fashion ectoplasm drawn from the Astral Plane into a golem-like construct under your control. You may use a bonus action to direct the creature. It repeats the last command if it is able or holds position if it is unable, but it will defend itself if attacked. If your construct is reduced to 0 hit points or if it is outside the range of this power, the power ends.

You fashion a Small ectoplasmic force that can perform simple tasks at your direction. The construct forms into existence in an unoccupied space with range. It has AC 10, 1 hit point, Strength of 2, Dexterity of 10, and Constitution of 10, darkvision to 60 feet, and is immune to the charmed, frightened, and poisoned conditions. It can’t attack. It can move up to 15 feet and interact with an object. It can move, lift, or carry objects, including basic tasks such as pouring a bottle or sweeping a floor.
You can only have one construct active at a time. Subsequent uses of this power will destroy your current ectoplasmic construct.
0. At 5th level, the range of this power increases to 60 feet. At 11th level the range increases to 120 feet. At 17th level the range increases again to 300 feet.

0. When you spend at least 1 power point to augment this power your construct has 3 HD (1d6 if Small, 1d8 if Medium, 1d10 if Large) and appropriate hit points. Its Strength is increased to 10 and its Constitution is equal to your manifesting ability score. It can move up to 30 feet per round. Your construct can make attacks, acting on your turn. It makes melee weapon attacks using your melee power attack modifier and deals 1d6 + your manifesting ability modifier bludgeoning damage.
Your construct uses your manifesting ability score when making skill and ability checks.

When you augment this power with at least 4 power points, you can make your construct Medium sized. If you augment this power with at least 10 power points, you can make your construct Large sized. A Medium or Large construct deals 2d6 + your manifesting ability modifier damage. A Large sized construct has a reach of 10 feet.
1. Increase the HD of your construct by 2. You can purchase this augmentation multiple times.
1. Increase your construct’s AC to 13.
You can empower this augmentation. For every additional power points spent you increase your construct’s AC by 1 up to 5 power points.
1. Your construct gains a swim speed equal to its movement speed.
1. Your construct gains blindsight to 60 feet.
2. Increase your construct’s movement speed by 10 feet. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 6 power points.
2. Your construct deals force damage instead of bludgeoning damage.
2. When your construct reduces a target to 0 hit points or when it scores a critical hit, once per turn it may make another attack against a different creature within its reach.

2. If the construct moves at least 10 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a single melee weapon attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 2d6 bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed a Strength saving throw against your power save DC or be pushed up to 10 feet away and knocked prone.
2. Once per round, you can have your construct attack each creature within reach of it you choose when it makes a melee attack.
2. Each creature hit by your construct must make a Constitution saving throw against your power DC. If the save is failed, it is poisoned for 1 minute.
3. Your construct gains a fly speed equal to its movement speed.
3. Your construct can make a second attack on its turn.

3. If your construct hits with an attack against a creature that is the same size or smaller than it, it grapples the creature, restraining both the creature hit and the construct. On the construct’s next turn it can replace one attack to crush the creature for normal damage plus an additional 2d6 bludgeoning damage. The escape DC is equal to your power save DC.
4. Your construct has a number of dice equal to its hit dice. In lieu of attacking, your construct can spend these dice to heal itself, using as many dice as you choose. These dice don’t refresh.
4. Your construct scores a critical hit on a 19-20.
4. Your construct gains damage resistance to nonmagical damage.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture, Visual (overt)
You create ectoplasm in a 10-foot square space within range. The ectoplasm has a gooey consistency that makes the surface difficult terrain.
When a creature must make a Constitution saving throw against this power, it makes only one roll and applies the result to each effect of this power that requires a saving throw.

0. At 5th level, you can create an additional 10-foot square (2 squares). At 11th level you can create another 10-foot square (3 squares), and again at 17th level (4 squares). Additional squares must be contiguous.

1. Your ectoplasm is especially sticky. Each creature who enters or reenters the area or who starts its turn within the area must make a Strength saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature must spend 3 feet of movement for every foot moved until the end of its turn.

3. You can take a bonus action to cause your ectoplasm to lash out with grasping tendrils against a creature within 15 feet of it so long as this power remains in effect. You make a melee power attack to hit the creature. A creature hit by the tendril is grappled. At the end of each of your turns, a grappled creature is pulled 5 feet closer to your creation. It can use its action to make a Strength check against your power save DC to break free of the tendril. A creature can only be pulled into the first 5-foot space of your creation it enters, after which time it is freed of the tendril.
You can empower this augmentation. For every additional 2 power points spent to do so, your creation pulls the target an additional 5 feet.
You can also empower this augmentation to increase the reach of your tendril by 15 feet (total 30 feet) by spending an additional 4 power points (7).
4. Replace your squares with 10-foot cubes. Each cube must be contiguous and rest on a surface. Saving throws made against your ectoplasm are made with disadvantage when manifested as cubes.

5. Your ectoplasm is disturbing to creatures which come into contact with it. Each creature within the ectoplasm when this power is manifested, who enters or reenters the area, or who end its turn in the area, must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature is unsettled so long as it remains in contact with your ectoplasm and for one minute after leaving the area.
You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 6 power points (11). A creature unsettled by your ectoplasm is also poisoned by it.

9. Your ectoplasm takes on an acidic quality. Each creature who enters or reenters the acid or who starts its turn in the acid must make a Constitution saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature takes 2d8 acid damage and an additional 1d8 acid damage per 5 feet traveled through the area. If the save is successful, the creature takes half damage and doesn’t take any additional acid damage after exiting the acid.

A creature failing its save will also suffer an additional 1d8 acid damage after leaving the pool at the start of each of its turns so long as it remains in range and the power is in effect. At the end of each of its turns, the creature makes a new save, success ending the acid damage.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (13). Whenever a creature moves within 5 feet of your creation, you can use your reaction to cause your creation to burst in a 5-foot radius centered on the creature that triggered your reaction. Each creature within the radius is treated as if it had entered your creation. Additionally, the creature targeted by your reaction takes an additional 4d8 acid damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful save.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture, Visual (beam)

You telepathically whip a creature’s mind, crushing its confidence and infusing it with doubt. The creature must make a Charisma saving throw. If the save is failed it is affected by this power so long as it remains in effect and until the end of its next turn after the power ends. The creature makes a new saving throw at the end of each or its turns to overcome the effect. If the save is successful, the power ends immediately for the creature.
The creature subtracts 1d4 from its attack rolls and ability checks when it fails its saving throw. Whenever the creature takes damage from a reaction, it can’t move until the start of its next turn.
1. Your target can’t make reactions or the Ready action while this power remains in effect.
2. You can affect an additional target in range, provided each target is no more than 15 feet apart from another target. This augmentation can be taken multiple times up to 8 power points.
3. Increase the amount subtracted from the creature’s attack rolls and ability check to 1d6.
You can empower this augmentation to increase this penalty to 1d8 by expending an additional 4 power points (7) or to 1d10 by expending a further 6 power points (13).
5. Your target is frightened while this power remains in effect.
9. The creature is crippled with anguish and can only take the Dash action during its turn.

17. You crush the creature’s ego, entrapping it in utter despair. It crumples to the ground and is incapacitated. The creature won’t attempt to defend itself. Each time it takes damage, it can make a new saving throw. If the save is successful, the power expires at the end of its next turn.
Detection: Psychic, Visual (overt)

Your body is able to stretch and bend in ways not normally possible. You can stretch your arms and legs (or other limbs) out an additional 10 feet. Doing so, you increase your movement and climb speeds by 5 feet while this power remains in effect. You can also use your action to move yourself to the extreme of your reach. This has no effect on your melee reach. You also can’t perform intricate tasks that require a skill check when stretched out.
You can revert to your normal shape at will without taking an action, including any shape changes from augmentations of this power.
While this power is in effect, you can substitute your melee power attack bonus in place of your melee weapon attack bonus. Also, your bones can’t be broken.

1. Increase the length you can stretch your limbs by 5 feet. You can take this augmentation multiple times. Each additional 10 feet of stretching increases your movement and climb speed an additional 5 feet.
2. When you stretch your arms, you can perform intricate tasks remotely, but do so with disadvantage.
You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (6) to not suffer disadvantage on ability checks because of this power.
3. Increase your melee reach by 5 feet while this power remains in effect. You can bend your attacks to reach around corners and cover. Your reach can’t be increased by more than you can stretch.
You can empower this augmentation by spending additional power points. For every 5 additional power points you spend to do so, increase your melee reach another 5 feet.

3. You can flatten yourself, increasing your buoyancy and allowing you to float on air currents or with gusts of wind. Flattening yourself takes a bonus action, unless you are falling or in danger of being crushed, in which case you may do so using your reaction. Once flattened, you remain flat so long as this power is effect or you chose to resume your normal shape.

You fall as if under the effect of feather fall. You can also float on water or other liquids, but this doesn’t grant you any protection from hazardous substances such as lava. You can also sail on the wind like a kite, moving at a rate equal to the wind, but you have no control of which direction you move. While flattened, you can’t be crushed or damaged by cave-ins and debris and can move through debris using your climb speed.

5. When you first manifest this power, or by using your action while it remains in effect, you can expand your body into a sphere with a radius of half your maximum stretch reach. As a sphere you have advantage on rolls to resist grapple and can’t be forced into a space smaller than your expanded size could fit within. Additionally, you can’t be knocked prone. You don’t gain any mass, and can still be pushed normally.
You can roll to move, and double your normal movement speed when rolling downhill.
5. You gain the Amorphous trait, but treat movement through small spaces as difficult terrain.
You can empower this augmentation to treat small spaces as standard terrain by spending an additional 4 power points (9).

7. You can rapidly bend and twist your body. This allows you to reduce all piercing and bludgeoning damage dealt to you by 1d10. When you grapple a creature, you may wrap the creature in your body, and gain advantage on your grapple check. You may use your manifesting ability score in place of your Strength when you grapple, and you are treated as one size category larger during the grapple.
If you augment the length you can stretch by at least 6 power points, you can increase your size category for the purpose of grappling by an additional step.
You can empower this augmentation by spending additional power points. For every 2 additional power points spent, increase the piercing and bludgeoning damage reduction by an additional 1d10.

9. You can expand your arms and fists into boulder-sized proportions. You can use your action to make a special attack against one creature and one additional creature, provided that creature is within 5 feet of the target. Each creature must make a Strength saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature takes 4d6 + your manifesting ability modifier bludgeoning damage and is knocked back 5 feet, or 10 feet if it is smaller than you. If a creature can’t be knocked back because of obstruction, that creature is knocked prone. A creature that is larger than you or one that succeeds its saving throw isn’t knocked back or prone.
Detection: Psychic, Visual (glow)

When this power is first manifested, and by using your action on subsequent turns while it remains in effect, you can transfer injury from a target you touch to yourself. You transfer 1d6 points of damage from a target to yourself. Damage you take as a result of this transference can’t be reduced or prevented, but also doesn’t require you to make a concentration save. You can’t transfer damage that would reduce you to less than 1 hit point.
0. At 5th level, increase the amount of damage transferred by 1d6 (2d6). At 11th level you transfer an additional 1d6 damage (3d6), and again at 17th level (4d6).

1. You can transfer injuries from yourself to another creature. You must succeed a melee power attack roll. If you succeed, you deal up to 1d6 necrotic damage to your target, and you regain an equal amount of hit points. You can transfer no more damage to the target than you have suffered. For example, if you have only suffered 2 points of damage, you can only deal 2 points of necrotic damage to your target regardless if your damage roll is 3 or higher. You can use your action on subsequent turns to transfer additional damage while this power remains in effect. This power gains no benefit from a critical hit.
If your target is grappled, your melee power attack automatically hits. If a creature is willing, you also automatically hit.

3. A hostile creature hit by your power must make an opposed grapple check against you. You may use your manifesting ability score in place of your Strength. If you win the grapple, your target is grappled.
4. Increase the maintenance time of this power 10 minutes.

5. You can transfer one poison or one disease of your choice (including the poisoned condition) when you take or deal damage, even if 0 hit points are transferred. If unwilling, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your power save DC. If failed, the creature is affected by the condition for the remainder of its duration. If the creature is immune to the transferred effect, the effect ends.

6. You can share beneficial conditions and effects from transmutation spells of 3rd level or less, or psychometabolic powers augmented by 6 power points or less with a willing creature you’re in contact with or each willing creature within your affinity link. Effects in place before manifesting this power aren’t shared, only new effects applied while this power is in effect. Transferred effects end when this power is no longer in effect or the spell or power expires on its own.

7. You can transfer blindness or deafness when you take or deal damage, even if 0 hit points are transferred. If unwilling, the creature must make a Constitution saving throw against your power save DC. If failed, the creature is affected by the effect for the remainder of its duration. If the creature is immune to the transferred effect, the effect ends.

9. You create an affinity link with a creature you hit with this power. So long as this power remains in effect, at your choice, each time your or the affected creature takes damage or regains hit points, the other receives the same damage or healing. An unwilling creature must make a Constitution saving throw when first hit. If the save fails, the creature remains in the affinity link so long as this power remains in effect.
You can transfer damage or an effect (if augmented that way) from one creature to another creature in your link without needing to make an attack roll, provided it is within 60 feet of you.
If a creature moves more than 60 feet from you, nothing can be transferred. Once the creature is again within 60 feet of you, you can transfer damage and effects to and from it normally.

You can empower this augmentation by spending an additional 4 power points (13), to link up to five willing creatures and yourself, provided each creature is touching you at the time of manifestation.
Detection: Psychic, Gesture, Visual (beam, overt)

You create a psychokinetic blast that deals bludgeoning damage to a target within range. Each creature hit must make a Strength saving throw. If the save is failed, the creature takes 1d6 bludgeoning damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you.

If a creature is knocked into a wall or a solid object that is one or more size categories larger than it, the creature will take 1d6 bludgeoning damage per 10 feet of movement it can’t move due to obstruction. If a creature is knocked over an edge, the creature will fall.
This is an energy power; you can substitute your energy specialization’s damage type in place of the bludgeoning damage if you possess a class feature that permits this.
0. At 5th level targets take an additional 1d6 damage (2d6). At 11th level targets take an additional 1d6 damage (3d6), and again at 17th level (4d6).
0. If you spend 1 or more power points to augment this power, you deal half damage to a target that succeeds its saving throw.
1. Increase the range by 20 feet. You can take this augmentation multiple times up to 12 power points.
2. Increase the distance you push targets by 10 feet.
You can empower take this augmentation. For each additional power point spent to do so increase the distance you push a target by 10 feet up to 8 power points.

3. You create an exploding line of force. Each target in a line from you up to your maximum range is struck by your concussive force. Each creature that fails its save is pushed to either side of the line (your choice). You can’t take this augmentation with another augmentation that changes the shape of your concussive force.
You can empower this augmentation to increase the width of the line. For every 4 power points you spend this way, you increase the width of your line by 5 feet.
4. Increase the damage from the initial hit by 2d6.
You can empower this augmentation. For each additional power point you spend to do so, increase the damage by 1d6 up to 10 power points.

5. You create a cone of concussive force with half the range of the power which strikes each target in its range. You can’t take this augmentation with another augmentation that changes the shape of your concussive force.

7. You create an explosion of energy in a sphere with a radius equal to one fourth this power’s range centered on you, striking each target, except you, in the area. Each creature within half the radius makes its Strength saving throw with disadvantage. You can’t take this augmentation with another augmentation that changes the shape of your concussive force.

9. You lob a wad of concussive force that explodes in kinetic energy when it reaches its target, striking each target within a 10-foot radius sphere.
